label: Description
value: Pyriform body with vertical gadrooning and horizontal moldings. Curved spout, wide at bottom and narrow in upper part. Domed, hinged cover. Scrolled star handle with small spur.

label: Description
value: Light blue silk ribbon brocaded in a blue and white floral pattern comprised of a curvilinear floral vine that intersects with a slender vine of small leaves.

label: Description
value: Drug jar, decorated on one side in blue with figure of putto bearing a basket of fruit, within a framework of flowers and foliage.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch in memory of her son, Clyde Fitch

label: Description
value: Brisé fan of tortoise shell with gold silk ribbon. Sticks carved in low relief with an all-over design of small medallions. Guards elaborately carved in high relief with chinoiserie designs.

label: Physical description
value: Carved tortoise shell sticks, silk ribbon

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Clarence Hoblitzelle; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Fan with ivory sticks and paper leaf. Leaf painted on front and back with scenes of Chinese life. Faces of figures are painted on small bits of applied ivory. Garments of figures are made of silk applied to the paper leaf. The ivory sticks are lace-carved with flowers, figures, etc. Guards are carved in high relief.

label: Physical description
value: Painted paper leaf, carved ivory sticks

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Clarence Hoblitzelle; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Brisé fan of carved ivory held with gold silk ribbon. Carved in lace-like fashion with houses, boats, figures. Guards similarly carved in very high relief.

label: Physical description
value: Carved and pierced ivory sticks, silk ribbon

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (open): 25.4 x 40.6 cm (10 x 16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Clarence Hoblitzelle; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Brisé fan of tortoise shell with green silk ribbon. Blades mostly plain with three carved panels. Guards carved in high relief.

label: Physical description
value: Carved tortoiseshell sticks, silk ribbon (probably replacement), tortoiseshell washer and metal loop at the rivet

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Clarence Hoblitzelle; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: White damask with a pattern of symmetrically swinging broad bands with flowers and foliage enclosing central symmetrical group of flowers, grapes and wheat.

label: Description
value: Two fragments of white silk moire with brocaded design in shades of green, red, pink, and yellow. Symmetrical arrangement of floral sprays reversed on either side of central line.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft; moire
Study for "Searchlight, Harbor Entrance, Santiago de Cuba"

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of a cannon and the searchlight on the parapet of the Spanish fort, Morro Castle, with the harbor of Santiago de Cuba visible in the background.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, white chalk on gray paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
Soldier Giving Water to a Wounded Companion

label: Description
value: Recto: Horizontal view of a soldier kneeling beside a wounded companion, holding his head, and giving him a drink from a canteen, as a third soldier stands and watches at left foreground. A faintly drawn group appears in right background. Verso: A drill ground.

value: Recto: Horizontal view of a soldier kneeling beside a wounded companion, holding his head, and giving him a drink from a canteen, as a third soldier stands and watches at left foreground. A faintly drawn group appears in right background. Verso: A drill ground.

label: Description
value:
Vertical view showing the heads of four soldiers, with color notation, "Blue", beside head, at center left; and an indistinct letter, at top.  

Verso:  various sketches of (1)a clouded sky, several "W's" inscribed at top; (2)a shore with boulders and vegetation emerging from the water, shown horizontally, with "Redish - white/ L[ight] B[lue]", the places to which are referred to being marked with circles and strokes, respectively, inscribed in the sky.

label: Description
value: Six studies of soldiers' heads; three across top and bottom. Four corner heads wear same hat with circular, flat top; those in upper left and lower right have "28" on hat.  Soldier in lower row center wears Zuave headdress.  Verso: standing woman with long hair, in profile, wearing cloak and hat. Several upside-down heads sketched at top of page.

Verso:  Figures of women and a flight of steps.

value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.

label: Description
value:
Recto:  Vertical full-length view of a bearded soldier, in cap and uniform, facing left and blowing a bugle with his right hand, while holding a sword in his left hand. Beside this study to the right is another three-quarter length view of solider, slightly larger in scale and turned to right.  

Verso:  Horizontal scene of an army camp with campfire and three soldiers in foreground; wagon train, wagons and mules in background.
